title: The Great Gatsby
description: Nick Carraway moves to West Egg and becomes neighbors with the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby, who throws extravagant parties in hopes of reuniting with his lost love, Daisy Buchanan.

chapters.title: West Egg
chapters.content: Nick Carraway, a young man from Minnesota, moves to West Egg, Long Island, in the summer of 1922. He rents a small house next to a mansion owned by a mysterious man named Jay Gatsby. Nick's cousin, Daisy Buchanan, lives across the bay in the more fashionable East Egg with her husband Tom. Nick visits them and meets Jordan Baker, a professional golfer. He learns that Tom is having an affair. Daisy tells Nick about her daughter and seems unhappy. Later that evening, Nick sees Gatsby standing alone on his lawn, reaching out toward a green light across the water.

chapters.title: The Valley of Ashes
chapters.content: Nick describes the valley of ashes, a desolate area between West Egg and New York City. This is where George and Myrtle Wilson live. Myrtle is Tom Buchanan's mistress. Tom takes Nick to meet Myrtle at their apartment in New York. They have a party with Myrtle's sister and some friends. Myrtle talks about wanting to leave her husband. She mentions Daisy's name, and Tom becomes violent, breaking Myrtle's nose. This shows Tom's brutal nature and the corruption beneath the surface of the wealthy society.

chapters.title: Gatsby's Party
chapters.content: Nick receives an invitation to one of Gatsby's extravagant parties. He attends and is amazed by the opulence and the number of guests. Most people don't know Gatsby and have never met him. They just come for the free food and alcohol. Nick finally meets Gatsby, who has a remarkable smile. Gatsby tells Nick that they served in the same division during the war. Gatsby seems to know a lot about Nick. Later, Jordan tells Nick that Gatsby wants to ask him a favor. The party shows Gatsby's wealth and his desire to be accepted by high society, but also his isolation and loneliness.

chapters.title: Gatsby's Past
chapters.content: Gatsby takes Nick to lunch in New York. He tells Nick about his past, claiming he comes from a wealthy family in the Middle West and was educated at Oxford. He shows Nick a medal from the war. Gatsby asks Nick to arrange a meeting with Daisy. He explains that he and Daisy were in love five years ago, but he was too poor to marry her. Now he has become wealthy and wants to win her back. Nick agrees to help. This reveals Gatsby's motivation: everything he has done—his wealth, his parties, his mansion—has been to win back Daisy's love.

chapters.title: The Green Light
chapters.content: Nick arranges the meeting between Gatsby and Daisy at his house. Gatsby is extremely nervous. When Daisy arrives, Gatsby is awkward at first, but they reconnect. Gatsby shows Daisy his mansion and his expensive possessions. He throws his shirts into the air to show her his wealth. Daisy cries because she has never seen such beautiful shirts. Later, Gatsby points out the green light at the end of Daisy's dock. He says that the green light was always his guiding light, his dream. But now that he has Daisy, the light seems less important. The green light symbolizes Gatsby's dream of recapturing the past and winning Daisy's love.
